body: Are you configuring your connection with a pre-instantiated driver object by any chance? Like in the first example shown in the readme?

https://book.cakephp.org/4/en/orm/database-basics.html#configuration

Here is an example of a datasource/db configuration.

I mean [**the `cakephp/database` package's readme**](https://github.com/cakephp/database/blob/master/README.md), which shows that exact usage.

The code that's failing for you obtains the configuration from the connection, and the connection doesn't know about the driver's configuration. That's a small problem right there.

It should work fine when creating a connection as shown in the docs that @othercorey linked, with the options passed to the connection. Passing only the `database` option would probably work too, though that's bit of a dirty workaround.

Not sure what could be done about it in the framework right now, as the driver's interface doesn't expose all the necessary configuration.

@UlrichEckhardt For the time being you can avoid the problem by creating your connection instance like this:

```php
$connection = new Cake\Database\Connection([
    'driver' => Cake\Database\Driver\Mysql::class,
    'host' => ...,
    'port' => ...,
    'database' => ...,
    'username' => ...,
    'password' => ...,
    'log' => false,
]);
```

@ADmad, thanks! Not only does that give me a workaround, I'm even saving a bunch of code like that. =)

As far as I'm concerned, this ticket could be closed. I'm not sure how the maintainers here see this though, i.e. whether they consider it an actual bug.

issue.title: Fix fetching driver config.
